div.l: Ay is þᵘou mery ⁊and þᵗat is fayre answeredA 4128
I haue herd say men shulde take of to þinges
Such as he fyndes or elles such as he bringes
But specially I pᵃray þe oste dere
Gete vs sum mete ⁊and drink ⁊and make vs chere
And we wyl pay trewly at þᵉ fulle
Wᵗith empti hond men may non̄ haukes tulle
Lo here redy oure silueer forte spende4135
Þᵉ myller to þᵉ toun̄ his douhter sende
For ale ⁊and bred ⁊and rosted hem a gos
And tyed her hors he sholde no more go los
In his owne chambre he made a bed
Wᵗith shetes ⁊and cloþes full fayre ⁊and well yspred4140
Nouht fro his owen bed ten fote or twelue
His douhter had a bed all by her self
Ryth in þᵉ same chambre by ⁊and by
Hit myth be no bet ⁊and þᵉ cause why
Þ̉er was no rowmer herborwe in þᵉ place4145
Þey souped ⁊and spake hem to solace
And dronken ouʳer strange ale at þᵉ best
Aboute myd nyth went þei to rest
Well hath þis myller farnesshed his hed
Full pale he was for dronken ⁊and not red4150
He bosteth ⁊and speketh þoruh þᵉ nose
As he were on þᵉ quac ⁊and on þᵉ pose
To bed he goth ⁊and wᵗith hym goth his wyf
As any Iay was he lyth ⁊and Iolyf
So was his Ioly whystele wel ywet4155
Þᵉ cradell at þᵉ chambeer dore was set
To rokken ⁊and to ȝeue þᵉ child souke
